title.value: Specification Library

description.value: Defines the asset-collection library containing the US Public Health specification assets.

title.value: eRSD PlanDefinition Instance Example

display.value: Workflow Definition

description.value: An example ersd PlanDefinition

display.value: United States of America

label.value: RCTC Value Set Library of Trigger Codes

description.value: This action represents the start of the reporting workflow in response to the encounter-start event.

textEquivalent.value: Start the reporting workflow in response to an encounter-start event

display.value: Initiate a reporting workflow
Indicates the start of an encounter

description.value: This action represents the start of the check suspected disorder reporting workflow in response to the encounter-start event.

textEquivalent.value: Check suspected disorders for immediate reportability and setup jobs for future reportability checks.

description.value: This action represents the check for suspected disorder reportability to create the patients eICR.

textEquivalent.value: Check Trigger Codes based on Suspected Reportable Value set.

expression.value: Is Encounter In Progress and Within Normal Reporting Duration or 72h or less after end of encounter?
%encounter.where((status = 'in-progress' and period.start + 1 day * %normalReportingDuration >= now()) or (status = 'finished' and period.end + 72 hours >= now())).select(true)

description.value: This action represents the check for suspected reportability of the eICR.

textEquivalent.value: Check Reportability and setup jobs for future reportability checks.

description.value: This action represents the check for reportability to create the patients eICR.

textEquivalent.value: Check Trigger Codes based on RCTC Value sets.

expression.value: Is Encounter Reportable and Within Normal Reporting Duration?

%encounter.where(period.start + 1 day * %normalReportingDuration >= now()).select(true) and (%conditions.exists() or %encounters.exists() or %immunizations.exists() or %procedures.exists() or %procedureOrders.exists() or %labOrders.exists() or %labTests.exists() or %labResults.exists() or %medicationAdministrations.exists() or %medicationOrders.exists() or %medicationDispenses.exists())
Most recent eICR sent over 72 hours ago?
((%lasteicr.last().entry[2].resource as Bundle).entry.first().resource as Composition).date < now() - 72 hours
Is Encounter In Progress and Within Normal Reporting Duration or 72h or less after end of encounter?
%inprogressencounter.where(status = 'in-progress' and period.start + 1 day * %normalReportingDuration >= now() or (status = 'finished' and period.end + 72 hours >= now())).exists()

description.value: This action represents the creation of the eICR. It subsequently calls validate.
This action represents the validation of the eICR. It subsequently calls route-and-send.
This action represents the routing and sending of the eICR.
This action represents the start of the reporting workflow in response to the encounter-modified event

textEquivalent.value: Start the reporting workflow in response to an encounter-modified event

display.value: Initiate a reporting workflow
Indicates modifications to data elements of an encounter

expression.value: Is Encounter Longer Than Normal Reporting Duration?

description.value: Release Description: This release includes code updates for the existing 108 conditions and adds codes for 24 new conditions: Alpha-gal Syndrome Amebiasis Animal Bite Injury Arsenic Exposure and Toxicity Botulism, Infant Cadmium Exposure and Toxicity Carbapenem-resistant Enterobacteriaceae (CRE) Chagas Disease Clostridioides difficile (C. diff) infection Cryptococcosis Drug Overdose and Poisoning, Non-opioid Glanders Vaccine Adverse Event Influenza-like Illness (ILI) Kawasaki Disease Meningitis Mercury Exposure and Toxicity Nipah Virus Infection Norovirus Infections Staphylococcus aureus Infection Streptococcal disease, invasive Typhus Fever Vaccinia Disease or Adverse Event Vancomycin-resistant Enterococci (VRE) Infection

purpose.value: Triggers for initiating decision support for electronic case reports

title.value: Diagnosis_Problem Triggers for Public Health Reporting

description.value: Purpose: Clinical Focus - This set of values contains diagnoses or problems that represent that the patient may have a potentially reportable condition. For example, these may be diagnoses recorded in an EHR problem list and diagnosis codes used for billing for the encounter. Purpose: Data Element Scope - Diagnoses or problems documented in a clinical record. Purpose: Inclusion Criteria - See individual value sets. Purpose: Exclusion Criteria - See individual value sets. Note - Includes codes from selected value sets used in the Reportable Condition Knowledge Management System (RCKMS) reporting logic. RCKMS value sets in VSAC are for informational use only. When implementing trigger codes for electronic case reporting, use the Reportable Condition Trigger Codes (RCTC) file.

purpose.value: Diagnoses or problems documented in a clinical record.

title.value: Lab Order Test Triggers for Public Health Reporting

description.value: Purpose: Clinical Focus - This set of values contains laboratory test names that may be used for placing a lab order for a test that represents that the patient may have a potentially reportable condition. These pertain to laboratory orders placed, coded in LOINC, where the lab order includes at least one test for a condition reportable upon suspicion of the condition. Purpose: Data Element Scope - Laboratory test names used in orders documented in a clinical record. Purpose: Inclusion Criteria - See individual value sets. Purpose: Exclusion Criteria - See individual value sets. Note - Includes codes from selected value sets used in the Reportable Condition Knowledge Management System (RCKMS) reporting logic. RCKMS value sets in VSAC are for informational use only. When implementing trigger codes for electronic case reporting, use the Reportable Condition Trigger Codes (RCTC) file.

purpose.value: Laboratory test names used in orders documented in a clinical record.

title.value: Lab Obs Test Triggers for Public Health Reporting

description.value: Purpose: Clinical Focus - This set of values contains laboratory observation test names that may represent that the patient may have a potentially reportable condition. These pertain to resulted laboratory reports, where the lab test name, coded in LOINC, is specific to a reportable condition. Purpose: Data Element Scope - Laboratory test names used in observations documented in a clinical record. Purpose: Inclusion Criteria - See individual value sets. Purpose: Exclusion Criteria - See individual value sets. Note - Includes codes from selected value sets used in the Reportable Condition Knowledge Management System (RCKMS) reporting logic. RCKMS value sets in VSAC are for informational use only. When implementing trigger codes for electronic case reporting, use the Reportable Condition Trigger Codes (RCTC) file.

purpose.value: Laboratory test names used in observations documented in a clinical record.

title.value: Medications Triggers for Public Health Reporting

description.value: Purpose: Clinical Focus - This set of values contains CVX,RXNORM,SNOMED medication codes that may represent that the patient may have a potentially reportable condition. These pertain to medications administered and medications prescribed, where the medication, coded in CVX,RXNORM,SNOMED, may be indicative of a reportable condition. Purpose: Data Element Scope - Prescription drugs names used in observations documented in a clinical record. Purpose: Inclusion Criteria - See individual value sets. Purpose: Exclusion Criteria - See individual value sets. Note - Includes codes from selected value sets used in the Reportable Condition Knowledge Management System (RCKMS) reporting logic. RCKMS value sets in VSAC are for informational use only. When implementing trigger codes for electronic case reporting, use the Reportable Condition Trigger Codes (RCTC) file.

purpose.value: Prescription drugs names used in observations documented in a clinical record.

title.value: Organism_Substance Release Triggers for Public Health Reporting

description.value: Purpose: Clinical Focus - This set of values contains organism and substance names received in a laboratory results report, that may represent that the patient has a potentially reportable condition. These pertain to resulted laboratory reports, where the test method is a non-specific test (e.g., general cultures not specific to a condition) and the result value, coded in SNOMED, includes the organism or substance name. Purpose: Data Element Scope - Nominal laboratory result values documented in a clinical record. Purpose: Inclusion Criteria - See individual value sets. Purpose: Exclusion Criteria - See individual value sets. Note - Includes codes from selected value sets used in the Reportable Condition Knowledge Management System (RCKMS) reporting logic. RCKMS value sets in VSAC are for informational use only. When implementing trigger codes for electronic case reporting, use the Reportable Condition Trigger Codes (RCTC) file.

purpose.value: Nominal laboratory result values documented in a clinical record.

title.value: Suspected_Disorder Triggers for Public Health Reporting

description.value: Purpose: Clinical Focus - This set of values contains suspected diagnoses or problems that represent that the patient may have a potentially reportable condition. For example, these may be diagnoses recorded in an EHR problem list and diagnosis codes used for billing for the encounter. Purpose: Data Element Scope - Suspected diagnoses or problems documented in a clinical record. Purpose: Inclusion Criteria - See individual value sets. Purpose: Exclusion Criteria - See individual value sets. Note - Includes codes from selected value sets used in the Reportable Condition Knowledge Management System (RCKMS) reporting logic. RCKMS value sets in VSAC are for informational use only. When implementing trigger codes for electronic case reporting, use the Reportable Condition Trigger Codes (RCTC) file.

purpose.value: Suspected diagnoses or problems documented in a clinical record.
